title: Correspondence between City of Fort Worth, Mayor's Office and Mattie Parker and Brooke Rollins (3.23.25-4.7.25)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Correspondence between City of Fort Worth, Mayor's Office and Mattie Parker and Brooke Rollins (3.23.25-4.7.25)
communications.communication:
Hi Jaclyn,

Thanks for your help on my previous request (E003214-031825). Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) Correspondence – including calls (phone, Zoom and Microsoft Teams), texts, emails and messages – between the Fort Worth City Council and Mayor Mattie Parker and the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) between 3/23/2025 and the date this revised request is received.

2) Correspondence — including phone calls, texts, emails and Microsoft Teams calls — from members of the Fort Worth City Council and Mayor Mattie Parker regarding the USDA or AG Secretary Brooke Rollins between 3/23/2025 and the new date this revised request is received.

Please provide a signed notification citing the legal authorities on which you rely if you determine that any information is exempt and will not be disclosed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge and processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage, and therefore we request that you waive any costs.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I also ask that our request be filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available (email: bdavis@star-telegram) – if not, secure file transfer, thumb drive, or CD-ROM.

Thank you

Bradford Davis

title: HOMELESS HOUSING SET-ASIDE Applications

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: HOMELESS HOUSING SET-ASIDE Applications
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

A list or summary of projects from January 1, 2020, to present that include units designated under the Homeless Housing Set-Aside Policy, 
including:

Project name

Developer

Number of set-aside units

Funding status (approved, pending, denied)

Any internal tracking documents, summary sheets, or compiled records maintained by the Mayor’s Office of Housing that reflect use or implementation of the Homeless Housing Set-Aside Policy.
This request does not seek full funding applications—only summary-level MOH documents.

For clarity, the Homeless Housing Set-Aside Policy referenced in this request is posted at:

https://www.boston.gov/departments/housing/policies

Additionally, the term "Homeless Housing Set-Aside" has been used consistently in public communications by officials , including:

https://www.taxcreditadvisor.com/articles/talking-heads-sheila-dillon-neighborhood-development-city-of-boston/

https://www.dotnews.com/2021/affordable-housing-numbers-city-2020-earn-good-reviews

https://www.boston.gov/sites/default/files/file/2025/03/Boston%20Resident%20Preference.pdf

https://bsky.app/profile/sheila-a-dillon.bsky.social/post/3llyttp5lss23

https://bsky.app/profile/sheila-a-dillon.bsky.social/post/3lk76z5jfsc2n

https://content.boston.gov/news/mayor-wu-announces-40-million-grant-funding-available-affordable-housing#:~:text=Four%20million%20dollars%20of%20funding,%2C%22%20said%20Mayor%20Michelle%20Wu

https://www.bostonhousing.org/en/News/Mayor-Wu-to-Invest-$40-Million-to-Create-and-Prese.aspx

https://www.bostonplans.org/news-calendar/news-updates/2023/04/18/mayor-wu-announces-community-preservation-act-fund


Given the City's repeated public use of this terminology, the request is clearly defined and not vague. If no such summaries or tracking records exist, I request written confirmation per 950 CMR 32.06(3)(c).

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian McCarter

title: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Anne Gibbs & K9 Hero Haven

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Anne Gibbs & K9 Hero Haven
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

All public records pertaining to animal cruelty investigations and any related enforcement actions conducted by the Pennsylvania Department of Agriculture, Bureau of Animal Health and Diagnostic Services, concerning the following:
▪︎ Anne Gibbs
▪︎ K9 Hero Haven, identified as #15949
▪︎ 176 Mahanoy Creek Lane, Herndon, PA 17830
▪︎ Information on the 'Mass Cull' of several working K9s who had resided at this facility that took place in February 2024 at Sunbury Animal Hospital
▪︎ Information on the Revocation of Anne Gibbs Kennel License
▪︎ Publicly Available Court Documents related to Anne Gibbs, her charges of animal neglect, and crimes committed on her property
▪︎ Records of Any K9s, CWDs, MWDs or other Dogs reported as 'Missing' from the property
▪︎ Medical records for CWD Cezar (German Shepherd), K9 Rex (Belgian Malinois), K9 Dondo, and K9 Sosa - (these are the 4 K9s who were in the care of PSPCA as of Nov 2024. These medical records are crucial to the adoption of these K9s)


This request encompasses, but is not limited to, all records of complaints received, inspection reports, investigative files, and any other documents generated or compiled by the Bureau in connection with said investigations. Specifically, the request seeks records covering the period from JANUARY 1, 2023, to the PRESENT DATE.

A waiver of all applicable fees associated with this request is respectfully requested. The disclosure of these records is crucial to myself, as I am the current adopter of a Contract Working Dog (CWD) that Anne Gibbs had her in possession for a period of time. I state 'Her Possession' because to refer to it as 'Care' would do a disservice to CWD Cezar. He was one of the 28 K9s that were seized from her property, and rescued from PSPCA, where he remained until I adopted him. In addition, this case is  demonstrably in the public interest, as it pertains to potential animal cruelty within an animal rescue organization. The release of this information would significantly contribute to public understanding of the oversight and operations of such organizations, thereby promoting animal welfare and fostering accountability within the community. This request is not predicated upon a commercial interest, but rather seeks to ensure the welfare of animals and promote transparency in the handling of animal cruelty complaints.

Expedited processing of this request is respectfully requested due to the potential ongoing nature of the alleged animal welfare concerns and the necessity for prompt action. Animal cruelty investigations are inherently time-sensitive, and delays in access to pertinent information may adversely affect ongoing investigations and the safety and well-being of the animals involved. There are several posts on Anne Gibbs public social media page, which I believe, are possible indicators of continued neglect.

I currently serve as a K9 Handler in the Private Sector, along with a branch of the Department of Defense. I am a Nationally Certified K9 Handler, with extreme knowledge and certification of these working K9s.  I am also still serving as a member of the United States Army, as a Military Police Officer. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or on USB/CD-ROM. I can provide the CD-ROM/USB if requested. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Very Respectfully,

Julia Valenti
CPT, MP
Commanding

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Julia Valenti

title: April 2025 Letters about TikTok from DOJ to Apple and Google

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: April 2025 Letters about TikTok from DOJ to Apple and Google
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

This is a request to the Department of Justice (DOJ) Mail Referral Unit. Please refer this request to all of the DOJ components likely to have responsive records.

On April 6, 2025, Bloomberg reported that "Apple Inc ... on Saturday [April 5, 2025] received a letter from Attorney General Pam Bondi telling the company it should follow President Donald Trump’s executive order that will extend the pause on a TikTok ban in the US, according to people with knowledge of the matter." Please refer to the attachment for an excerpt of the article, which is published at: https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2025-04-06/apple-keeps-tiktok-on-its-store-after-assurances-from-ag-bondi/.

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. The April 2025 letter about TikTok from DOJ to Apple Inc, described above.
2. Any similar April 2025 letters about TikTok from DOJ to Alphabet Inc. or its subsidiary Google LLC.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I am willing to pay fees for this request up to a maximum of $200. If you estimate that the fees will exceed this limit, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request.

I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Anthony Tan

Sincerely,

Aleksandra Conevska

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Records relating to Steve Presley time in office as Council Member and Mayor 2015-2022
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Steve Presley was an official of the City of Palestine during the time of 2015 thru 2022 either as council member or Mayor.  It is known that he used his personal email address and cell phone to communicate city business in official capacity,(txpharmacy@gmail.com).  It was his responsibility to make those records available and to turn them over to the city secretary to preserve open records. We are requesting any communication that he had with Attorney Ron Stutes, Wendy Ellis, Mike Alexander, Gene Mollard, and Laura Westbrook during the time frame of 2015 thru 2022. This would include any electronic communication by email or text messages.  As well as any other digital communications such as recordings or written paper, nothing to be excluded that meets this criteria.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

title: Privacy Access Request

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Privacy Access Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

In accordance with the Privacy Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552a(d)(1), I request copies of (1) all records about or pertaining to me in the possession or control of the U.S. Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) or the United States Digital Service (USDS), and (2) all records about or pertaining to me contained within any system of records in the possession or control of DOGE and USDS, including any records or information about or pertaining to me that is contained in a copy, made or received by an employee or contractor of DOGE or USDS, including members of “DOGE Teams” or other DOGE-affiliated individuals. Additionally, pursuant to 5 U.S.C. § 553a(c)(3), I request that you provide an accounting of the date, nature, and purpose of any disclosures that you, your agency, or your organization have made under 5 U.S.C. § 552a(b) providing access to a record about me to another person, organization, or agency, including within the Executive Office of the President. I further request that you confirm that DOGE, USDS, and members of “DOGE Teams” or other DOGE-affiliated individuals will comply with the requirement of 5 U.S.C. § 553a(e)(7), that no agency may maintain records cross-referenced with information about how I have exercised rights guaranteed by the First Amendment unless expressly authorized by statute or unless pertinent to an authorized law enforcement activity. To facilitate your response, I provide below my contact information and an itemized list of the records sought: 

Full name:  JOLYNN (Maidne name: OBLAK)  RICE
11 BENEDICT BLVD, ELMIRA, NY 14903
EMAIL: JoJoRice92@gmail.com
DOB: 1/1/74

Requested records pertaining to me containing my name, or the identifying number, symbol, or other identifying particulars assigned to me:  
 ◦ Education records 
◦ Financial transaction records
 ◦ Medical histories 
◦ Records relating to my eligibility for government benefits 
◦ Criminal or employment histories  
◦ Dissemination of my data to other entities: Pursuant to 5 U.S.C. § 552a(o)(2)(A)(ii), if any such records have been transmitted to a recipient agency as defined in 5 U.S.C. § 522a(a)(9), provide me a with copy of the written agreement between DOGE and/or USDS and the recipient agency or non-Federal agency specifying — (A) the purpose and legal authority for conducting the program; (B) the justification for the program and the anticipated results, including a specific estimate of any savings; (C) a description of the records that will be matched, including each data element that will be used, the approximate number of records that will be matched, and the projected starting and completion dates of the matching program; D) all other information required in such written agreement under 5 U.S.C. § 552a(o)(1)(A)-(K). Privacy Act Access Request Page 3 

Where possible, please provide responsive materials in an electronic format by mail to : Jojorice92@gmail.com

 Alternatively, please provide responsive materials in native format or in PDF format on a USB drive. Please send any responsive material sent in paper or USB drive form by mail to: 11 Benedict Blvd, Elmira, NY 14903. If you contend that inspection of records must occur in person, provide me with accessible place(s) of inspection and the procedure to schedule it. Under 5 U.S.C. §552a(f)(5), you may not charge any fees for the search and review of these records. If paper copies are provided, please state the cost of duplication, and whether it exceeds the standard $0.05 per page.  If you deny this request, in whole or in part, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of appeal procedures available to me under the law.

I expect a timely acknowledgement, response, and production of the requested records and information in accordance with the requirements of the Privacy Act. Sincerely,

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jolynn Rice

title: Esther Medina Arrest – February 19, 2025

communications.subject: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Esther Medina Arrest – February 19, 2025
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all records related to the arrest of Esther Medina on February 19, 2025, at approximately 11:19 PM, by the Las Cruces Police Department (LCPD) in Dona Ana County, New Mexico. The arrest took place at or near 2341 Entrada Del Sol, Dona Ana, NM.

According to public records, Medina was arrested and charged with:

Three counts of Abuse of a Child – Statute: 20AB (Felony)

Aggravated DWI – Statute: 21B (Misdemeanor)

I am specifically requesting:

The full incident and arrest reports, including probable cause affidavits, officer narratives, and any supplemental documentation

Any available body-worn camera (BWC) footage from responding officers

911 call audio and transcripts related to this incident

CAD logs, dispatch notes, or internal communications

Any photographs, scene documentation, and forensic or toxicology reports

Documentation provided to or received from Child Protective Services or related agencies

This request is submitted in the public interest due to the serious charges involving child endangerment and aggravated driving while intoxicated.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Thomas Jackson

title: Correctional Officers as School Resource Officers

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Correctional Officers as School Resource Officers
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Records that detail the extent to which correctional officers and other Department of Corrections (DOC) employees act as school resource officers (SROs) from January 1, 2023 to the time this request is filled. Specifically, I request records that show the name and title of DOC department employees who act as SROs, the school districts where they have worked, and any training or certification that the employee has received related to work as an SRO.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joshua Dankoff

title: Kyle McMahan Arrest – December 5, 2024

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Kyle McMahan Arrest – December 5, 2024
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all records related to the arrest of Kyle Stephen McMahan on December 5, 2024, at approximately 12:00 AM, by the Sarasota County Sheriff’s Office, in or near Sarasota, Florida.

According to public records, McMahan was arrested and charged with multiple serious felony offenses, including:

Sexual Battery by Person 18 or Older on Victim Under 12 Years Old (3 counts)

Lewd or Lascivious Molestation on Victim Under 12 by Offender 18 or Older

Lewd or Lascivious Conduct by Person 18 or Older

Lewd or Lascivious Exhibition to a Victim Under 16 Years Old by Person 18 or Older

Distribution or Transmission of Obscene Material to a Minor

I am specifically requesting:

The full incident and arrest reports, including probable cause affidavits, investigative summaries, and any related documentation

Any body-worn camera (BWC) footage, if applicable, from the arrest or initial contact

Any digital forensic reports, evidence logs, and descriptions of materials collected or analyzed

911 call audio and transcripts, dispatch (CAD) logs, or officer communications

Any forensic interview reports involving the victim(s) and any documentation shared with the State Attorney’s Office

Any relevant search warrant returns and associated filings

Given the extremely serious and sensitive nature of the charges, this request is made in the public interest to support transparency in criminal investigations involving child exploitation and abuse.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Thomas Jackson

title: Leah Jenness Arrest – June 15, 2023

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Leah Jenness Arrest – June 15, 2023
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all records related to the arrest of Leah Kirsten Jenness on June 15, 2023, at approximately 12:00 AM, by the Charlotte County Sheriff’s Office (CCSO-FL0080000), at or near 5521 Gillott Blvd., Port Charlotte, FL 33981.

According to public records, Jenness was charged with 19 serious felony counts, including:

Multiple counts of Aggravated Assault with a Deadly Weapon without Intent to Kill

Multiple counts of Robbery with a Firearm

Murder Not Premeditated During Specific Felony

Torture Inflicting Serious Injury or Death

Burglary While Armed

Bond violation/revocation

The total bond amount was listed as $6,925,000.

I am specifically requesting:

The complete arrest and incident reports, including all officer narratives, probable cause affidavits, and charge documentation

Any body-worn camera (BWC) footage, in-car camera footage, or surveillance footage obtained or recorded during the investigation or arrest

Any 911 call recordings, CAD/dispatch logs, or radio traffic from law enforcement responding to this event

Crime scene photographs, forensic reports, and collected evidence logs

Statements from witnesses, co-defendants, or victims

Any documents forwarded to the State Attorney’s Office related to charges of homicide, robbery, or aggravated assault

Given the extreme seriousness of the charges—including murder, armed robbery, and aggravated assault—this request is submitted in the public interest for transparency and accountability in the handling of high-profile violent felony cases involving young defendants.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Thomas Jackson
